results.firPara: Hosts hope a bravura tournament will help erase security fears and their national team are settled and ready for opening match against Romania
results.secPara: Here we go then. Get ready for – well, what exactly? Six years, one dethroned Uefa president,€2bn costs and a thoroughgoing tournament expansion programme in the making, France 2016 is finally upon us. Not quite in a haze of unbound, horn‑tooting glee; more with a sense of hopeful, cautious excitement that will with any luck begin to rev up through the gears as France and Romania take to the field at Stade de France on Friday night for what seems likely to be a bravura tournament opener.
results.webTitle: France takes deep breath as Deschamps’ favourites make Euro 2016 entrance | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: • Host nation beefs up security after November attacks in Paris
results.secPara: At the national stadium where three suicide bombers targeted thousands of football fans in November amid attacks across Paris that killed 130 people, Frances footballers kick off Euro 2016 on Friday night desperately hoping to shift the focus back to action on the pitch.
results.webTitle: France hopes expanded Euro 2016 can shake off security fears to flourish

results.firPara: Hope Solo, the US womens team goalkeeper and one of the top stars in womens soccer, has been denied a request to have her June 2014 assault charges dismissed, meaning the case should move forward to trial.
results.secPara: In June 2014, Solo was charged in Washington state with two counts of domestic violence – one against half-sister Teresa Obert and one against Oberts son, who was 17 at the time. But the charges were dismissed in January 2015 on procedural grounds, after witnesses for the prosecution refused multiple times to cooperate with Solos defense team. However, prosecutors in Kirkland, where the alleged assault took place, appealed the dismissal and filed a motion to have the misdemeanor case reinstated, which a higher court granted in October.
results.webTitle: US soccer star Hope Solo fails in bid to have assault charges tossed out

results.firPara: An examination of player data at Euro 2016 provides a few surprising stats (and a few less surprising ones)
results.secPara: As Sevilla proved by outplaying Liverpool to win their third consecutive Europa League final, there is more to La Liga than just Barcelona and Real Madrid. The strength in depth in Spain is unrivalled at club level at the moment and it is a surprise, then, to see that La Liga will only be the fifth most represented league at Euro 2016, pipped to fourth place by the Turkish Super Lig, a reflection of how the money on offer in Turkey is making it more attractive to foreign players.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: the tallest team, age v experience and most represented leagues

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Euro 2016 predictions, pesky champions and much more

results.webTitle: The Fiver | Plenty of entertaining big talk

results.firPara: Gareth Bale said Wales are not a one-man team and revealed if there was one player he could call on from the past to play alongside him at Euro 2016 it would be Ryan Giggs, who never got the chance to represent his country at a major tournament.
results.secPara: The Real Madrid forward was in confident mood before Saturdays opening Group B game against Slovakia in Bordeaux and said although it felt surreal to be involved in the buildup to a tournament instead of watching from afar, Wales were not in France to make up the numbers.
results.webTitle: Gareth Bale insists Wales will not be a one-man team at Euro 2016

results.firPara: Take our quiz to find out which team you should be supporting at this years tournament in France
results.secPara: • The ultimate Euro 2016 quiz 51 questions for 51 matches

results.firPara: A message from rugby union resonated in Scottish football. Geoff Cooke, then coach of the British & Irish Lions, gave a lecture in 1993 at which Craig Brown was in attendance.
results.secPara: Geoff pointed out that you could go down a route of spending millions on youth development but if your national team, your flagship team, wasnt doing well then you were wasting your money, the former Scotland manager recalls. The same could apply to an individual; can you imagine trying to promote tennis in Scotland without Andy Murray?
results.webTitle: Scottish football is outside looking in as Euro 2016 prepares for kick-off | Ewan Murray

results.firPara: This article is part of the Guardians Euro 2016 Experts Network, a cooperation between some of the best media organisations from the countries who have qualified for France. theguardian.com is running previews from three countries each day in the run-up to the tournament kicking off on 10 June.
results.secPara: That Aron Gunnarsson is still the captain of Iceland demonstrates the esteem in which he is held by the managers Lars Lagerback and Heimir Hallgrímsson. Not long after he had been handed the armband Gunnarsson remarked the Iceland squad had been advised against venturing out of their hotel before their World Cup qualifier in Tirana in October 2012 because Albanians are most criminals. The Cardiff City midfielder could easily have been demoted as a result but something – perhaps Gunnarssons swift apology or perhaps a feeling that something was lost in translation – convinced Lagerback and Hallgrímsson to stand by him.
results.webTitle: Aron Gunnarsson: Iceland’s midfield leader and long-throw star

results.firPara: This article is part of the Guardians Euro 2016 Experts Network, a cooperation between some of the best media organisations from the countries who have qualified for France. theguardian.com is running previews from three countries each day in the run-up to the tournament kicking off on 10 June.
results.secPara: With a 4-4-2 formation favoured by the coaching team and used to impressive effect in qualifying, it is the central midfield partnership of Aron Gunnarsson and Gylfi Sigurdsson that will prove pivotal for Iceland. It is a system that has been implemented since Lars Lagerback and Heimer Hallgrimsson took charge in 2012 but it was not until a World Cup qualifier a year later that Sigurdsson assumed a more central role, shining in a 4-4 draw with Switzerland.
results.webTitle: Iceland Euro 2016 team guide: tactics, key players and expert predictions
